application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: To fell to ground level One Beech (TG2 on application) within Group 1 and To fell one Lawson Cypress (H1 on application) T13 both on TPO 229
decision_conditions: The mature Cypress and Beech trees make a significant contribution to the visual amenity and arboreal character of the Gatehill Farm Estate Area of special local character. The trees are both considered to have Moderate amenity values.
The applicant is alleging that the protected Beech tree is implemented in causing the damage to their property and as a result they wish to remove the tree.

Applications to remove a protected tree due to suspected structural damage must be supported by relevant technical evidence which demonstrates 'beyond reasonable doubt' that any alleged structural damage has been caused by the implicated tree. Such evidence would usually include (but not be limited to):
1. Root testing - to show that roots of the implicated tree have been found below the area of damage; and
2. Crack / Level monitoring date - to demonstrate that the crack damage / building movement is seasonal and cyclical (that is, cracks open during the drier summer months and close during the wi
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
